articles.headline: Greeks Spend in Droves, Afraid of Losing Savings to a Bailout
articles.snippet: Facing unknown consequences if Greece is pushed out of the eurozone, panicked citizens are buying appliances and jewelry, and even prepaying their taxes.
articles.abstract: Facing unknown consequences if Greece is pushed out of the eurozone, panicked citizens are buying appliances and jewelry, and even prepaying their taxes.
articles.lead_paragraph: MAROUSI, Greece — Business has been so brisk in the giant Kotsovolos appliance and electronics store in this upper-middle-class suburb of Athens that you might think a sale was on.

articles.headline: Yahoo Will Enter Daily Fantasy Sports Market
articles.snippet: The Internet company says it will host daily and one-week fantasy games, joining a market estimated to generate $2.6 billion in revenue this year.
articles.abstract: The Internet company says it will host daily and one-week fantasy games, joining a market estimated to generate $2.6 billion in revenue this year.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Even as legalized gambling has spread nationwide to include lotteries, casinos and just about every imaginable type of slot machine, the notion of betting on sports has remained, outside of Las Vegas, largely in the shadows.
articles.byline: By Vindu Goel and Joe Drape

articles.headline: Baltimore Fires Police Chief in Wake of Unrest and Crime Surge
articles.snippet: Anthony W. Batts was fired hours after the police union accused him of taking a passive approach during the riots that followed Freddie Gray’s death.
articles.abstract: Anthony W. Batts was fired hours after the police union accused him of taking a passive approach during the riots that followed Freddie Gray’s death.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Baltimore police commissioner, Anthony W. Batts, who arrived in that city three years ago pledging change but lost the confidence of many in his rank and file in the wake of riots in April, was ousted Wednesday by Mayor Stephanie Rawlings-Blake, who said he had become “a distraction” that hindered efforts to fight a recent surge in violent crime.
articles.byline: By Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Richard A. Oppel Jr

articles.headline: Trans-Pacific Partnership’s Potential Impact Weighed in Asia and U.S.
articles.snippet: The agreement would have a substantial effect on a variety of industries, including banks, agriculture, pharmaceuticals and auto parts.
articles.abstract: The agreement would have a substantial effect on a variety of industries, including banks, agriculture, pharmaceuticals and auto parts.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Willie Fung, a leader in the world’s bra industry, knows just what he will do if negotiators from the United States and 11 Pacific Rim nations complete a Trans-Pacific Partnership trade agreement this summer.

articles.headline: Bad Math and a Coming Public Pension Crisis
articles.snippet: A panel of senior actuaries will consider whether to update, or elaborate on, the existing actuarial standards for public pensions.
articles.abstract: A panel of senior actuaries will consider whether to update, or elaborate on, the existing actuarial standards for public pensions.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Jim Palermo was serving as a trustee of the village of La Grange, Ill., he noticed something peculiar about the local police officers and firefighters. They were not going to live as long as might be expected, at least according to pension tables.

articles.headline: Can’t Fire Him: Republican Party Frets Over What to Do With Donald Trump
articles.snippet: With Donald Trump rising in opinion polls, officially neutral officials are reluctant to publicly criticize him, fearing an independent candidacy.
articles.abstract: With Donald Trump rising in opinion polls, officially neutral officials are reluctant to publicly criticize him, fearing an independent candidacy.
articles.lead_paragraph: Republican Party leaders agonize over the prospect that Donald Trump will mount a third-party candidacy that could undermine their nominee. They fear insulting the white working-class voters who admire him. They are loath to tangle with a threat-flinging firebrand for whom there are no rules of engagement.
articles.byline: By Michael Barbaro, Maggie Haberman and Jonathan Martin

articles.headline: Greek Plan Accepts Austerity to Get Debt Relief
articles.snippet: After grim predictions of collapse in Greece, a scramble was underway to work out the details of a new plan to bring the country back from the brink.
articles.abstract: After grim predictions of collapse in Greece, a scramble was underway to work out the details of a new plan to bring the country back from the brink.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATHENS — Only a day after grim predictions of financial and social collapse in Greece, a scramble appeared underway to work out the details of a new bailout package to bring the country back from the brink of falling out of the euro.
articles.byline: By Liz Alderman and James Kanter
